roshSummary.whoAtRisk:

roshSummary.natureOfRisk:
[R10.2] IN CUSTODY:

KNOWN ADULTS:
Intimidation, threats of violence, use of weapons or boiling water, physical education and violent assault, long term psychological impact as a result of Mr Smith violent behaviour. This harm may be cause in the course of physical altercation due to seeking revenge or holding grudges...
roshSummary.riskGreatest:
[R10.3] STATIC RISK FACTORS:

Mr Smith gender - At the time of the offence, Mr Smith was 35 years old and considered to be in the higher risk group.

STABLE DYNAMIC RISK FACTORS:
Thinking and behaviour - limited ability to manage mood or emotions poor impulse control. Mr Smith demonstrated cognitive deficit in committing the index offences and this still remains a concern...

unemployment

UNDERLYING FACTORS:
pro criminal attitudes supporting commission of crime...

Maintain emotional stability.
